verses.verse: The Nations Called to Praise God To the leader: with stringed instruments. A Psalm. A Song. (Num 6.25; Ps 4.6) May God be gracious to us and bless us and make his face to shine upon us, Selah
(Acts 18.25; Titus 2.11) that your way may be known upon earth, your saving power among all nations.
Let the peoples praise you, O God; let all the peoples praise you.
(Ps 96.10; 98.9) Let the nations be glad and sing for joy, for you judge the peoples with equity and guide the nations upon earth. Selah
(v 3) Let the peoples praise you, O God; let all the peoples praise you.
(Lev 26.4; Ps 85.12; Ezek 34.27) The earth has yielded its increase; God, our God, has blessed us.
(Ps 33.8) May God continue to bless us; let all the ends of the earth revere him.
